posts.body:
>>5b7b6780-6d91-4acf-968d-db285fcf8db1
ack

EDIT: looks like you can upload other file formats if you just change the extension to one of the supported ones.

>>2c6bebb3-fb09-47fb-92b0-1e7246c735ee
What the fuck is the Daile Beast going to do with IP addresses. They'll probably give you less information than the ZeroID that's now required, and they're something the US goverment ''always'' had access to on 8ch. The whole article reeks of lefty posturing.

>>9724bdef-dd24-45a2-b886-94cd7f43e0be
>>9e7c1d88-6996-4265-af7e-c7b1e87bd18f
>>64a87945-ff42-47db-acae-d21fc147e139
>>6cd1c674-2cef-476e-a523-c50f68c363dc

Anon you're quad posting, but more to the point, I agree that a permanent ID like ZeroID doesn't really mesh well with how the mute function operates. It's much more of a ban than a mute, and the permanent ID should probably be replaced with a more anonymous method like proof of work where the work required to post is based on a setting of the board. I also fear that because the information is available to look up anyone's post history across the site, people who do do that and make a fuss about it will start to come in and turn this place into a more traditional forum. Since >(1) posting was accepted on /v/ I don't think there are many people left who actually want an anonymous forum.

posts.subject: Were is every thing?
posts.body:
In case any new friends show up and are wondering were anything is, 08chan updated so that self signed certificates are no longer valid. This was done in order to combat spam, but hopefully it will only be temporary.

==How Do I Post==
You'll need to go to ZeroID http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ and register a username. Afterwards, on the top right of 08chan there should be a circle with the ZeroNet logo inside; click and drag it to the left to reveal 08chan's ZeroNet menu. Scroll down until you see the "IDENTITY ADDRESS" field and click change. In the popup window that appeared, click your ID that you just registered (somename@zeroid.bit). Dismiss the menu by clicking and dragging the ZeroNet logo to the right.

==Why Is No One Posting in My Thread==
Only the people who've downloaded a self-signed thread before the switch to ZeroID can see and post in them. Anyone who hasn't downloaded it will not be able to do so. As such, if you want more people to see something post in a new thread or make one.
Looks like everything died in the update.
You reminded me that N8's birthday was around this time of year; rip.
